website_summaries.verdict: The D-Link DIR-868L delivers as an advanced 802.11ac-enabled home router despite its underwhelming mobile apps and usage inflexibility.
pros: The easy-to-use D-Link DIR-868L offers fast data speeds, solid Wi-Fi coverage, and cloud-enabled features with mobile apps
cons: The router can't work as a media bridge or a standalone access point, and its mobile apps are limited both in features and functionality

customer_reviews.title: D-Link is a good router, but this unit...
customer_reviews.text: While I have used D-Link exclusively for my routers, this unit did not come with the written setup instructions or the network information card, which always accompanies D-Link routers. I don't have a smart phone so using the app was not even an option. I don't know if the seller took the network information card and the instructions out of the box or if it was shipped without them . Some of the network info was placed on the unit wrapper. I would have returned this unit except I need a router for work.
customer_reviews.author: Lalawman

customer_reviews.title: Range is a little better with the 1750 as far as signal strength to ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an aging DIR655 that was starting to drop connections with this. Took around 10 minutes to setup and replace the 655. You can use the setup Wizard for a simple config or do it yourself manually. Other reviewers were mostly positive about the wireless coverage and I would agree. Range is a little better with the 1750 as far as signal strength to rooms farther away. Has an on/off switch which is handier than not having one. I like the look of the thing - no antennas sticking out. Not using the usb feature so can't speak to that. Haven't had any issues or problems. All in all pretty pleased so far and got in under my $120 budget.
customer_reviews.author: SGinOR

customer_reviews.title: This version that is being sold by "In home services" is built for Dish Network
customer_reviews.text: The router that is being sold by "In home services" was built for Dish Network. I bought this router in Sep. 2019 and it had the firmware from 2013. I tried to install the security patches and upgrade the firmware but this Dish Network router only takes Dish Network firmware. This is hot garbage!!! If you don't care about upgrading or security, then this is a very good affordable router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Internet Access
customer_reviews.text: This router keeps dropping internet access on my cable modem. I hooked my PC directly to modem, and worked fine all day. This router keeps dropping the signal every 30-45 minutes, then to get it right again requires a re-boot (unplug/plug). Contacting DLink support is a laugh as they never reply to emails through their website, three sent. Need to return.
customer_reviews.author: John NYCTCA

customer_reviews.title: Extremely dated, and mine proved incompatible with DD-WRT
customer_reviews.text: A2 variant dumped at firesale prices was a Dish Network OEM device, not the retail product described here. Useless - Can't even get support or patches from D-Link or Dish. Stuck with original 1.0DSH buggy firmware, and rejects DDWRT.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Crago

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: No problems connecting this in my home and getting all of my electronics connected via wi-fi (Ipad, Android tablet, Iphone, two android phones, Apple Macbook, Dell desktop, and Samsung laptop. No issues with getting any of these devices connected. No lost or dropped connections. No buffering when streaming from Netflix. No issues when multiple devices connected at the same time. I haven't tried connecting a portable drive to the USB yet but will eventually. Haven't used the Apps yest but have downloaded them to my Iphone to try at a later date. Best router I have had!
customer_reviews.author: Rats56

customer_reviews.title: Liked it at first but turned out to be buggy.
customer_reviews.text: At first I really like it. The user interface is easy to use and it has a great real time graph to monitor network traffic. However two weeks later i start noticing that it would drop wireless devices and they would be unable to reconnect unless i rebooted the router. Needless to say I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: first d-link router ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased at least 7-8 linksys routers in the past and they were great until the last one, ea2700 which I purchased two of them (myself and somebody else) and let me tell you. the worst purchase ever, since I have new AC devices at the house decided to give this little guy a go and let me tell you. it impressed me! downloading files on the 5ghz AC at ~30 to 32MB/s (ACROSS THE APARTMENT!!). This is going thru 2 walls and this is the slowest connection I have seen. I have had it for about 2 weeks now and have yet to restart the device once!
customer_reviews.author: Myself

customer_reviews.title: Lan line dies after 6 month but WiFi is still working
customer_reviews.text: The Lan connection is dead just after 6 month, bought on Jan 25th and dies on July 29th, however, the WiFi is still okay. I have already tried 3 times to reset the router through the gateway, but the Lan is dead and no connection to the internet even the WiFi is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Wireless will not work
customer_reviews.text: Connecting via LAN produces a very fast and reliable connection. Connecting wirelessly has been all but impossible. I have been on the phone with tech support multiple times and was just told today that this router is defective. I have unfortunately spent so much time trying to get this device working that I have now passed the time when I can return it to Amazon. Totally my fault. D-link is going to have me go through the warranty process with them. If they treat me well I will update the review. Until then, I would not recommend this product at all!
customer_reviews.author: Geough

customer_reviews.title: This router does the job pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: This router does the job, I'm very happy with it. I change my old router for this one and at the moment I'm not disappointed. The look of the router helps to set it up in any location my friends doesn't even know it is a router until I told them. I recommend you to update the firmware as soon as you get it to fix minor issues. Also since I got it I had to reconfigure the wireless networks 2 times because sometimes when you shut it down for clean it, or you have a power outage the router loose the wireless configuration, I already connect it to an external battery (UPS) to avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph G.

customer_reviews.title: decent home router
customer_reviews.text: Wireless range is nothing special - same as my old WNDR-3700. It requires physical reboots every few weeks to keep wireless working or access the web UI. The good news is d-link is continuing to improve the firmware so it is worthwhile checking for updates. It has a couple of features I didn't think I was going to use but have been very worthwhile: - android apps for managing the router and accessing files - ability to attach USB drive and access files remotely
customer_reviews.author: M. Bresnahan

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless router and a great match with the Mac Pro
customer_reviews.text: I have seen many reviews that claim all sorts of problems. It's what you always see when network technologies are involved. The simple answer is almost always to do three things: (1) have a wired connection from the router to your (cable) modem, (2) let the device figure out how to set itself up, and (3) immediately download the latest firmware update. At that point, I can guarantee you it will connect to the internet. Then, set up WiFi. Then, make it yours. As far as its features are concerned, I can say that it does what it claims and is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Bonvanie

customer_reviews.title: It worked for a 2 days and gone bad
customer_reviews.text: After reading careful reviews and analyzed my requirement I placed order in amazon, it came on time, worked as expected, but something went wrong in 2 days, so I requested a replacement from Amazon, since this is a great product I do not want to go for something else. The customer service for D-link is WORST, sent few emails (no reply received) tried over phone after 45 minutes of hold time, connected with tech support, they found the issue. I'll write another review after a month once I received my replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Beemboy

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Got this router to upgrade an older model Belkin router. I researched a lot of different routers before deciding to buy the D-Link it had everything I was looking for in a new router. Hooked up and installed in a reasonable amount of time, had a small issue getting on the internet but a quick call to Comcast (had an issue with their modem) and everything was up and running perfectly. Had buffering issues with the old router and the new router cleared all that up. So far no problems with streaming video and two heavy online gamers in the house.
customer_reviews.author: ChriS

customer_reviews.title: A great device.
customer_reviews.text: A great device. Works decently in our two story, poured concrete floor, brick block walled house in Europe. (In one room on the floor below it, I still have to use an old, ethernet-linked router as an access point for adequate coverage, as this my main router is above that room at almost a 170 degree angle, separated by the concrete floor and two walls, and with the main electrical panel and hot water radiator pipes and registers in close proximity to the beam path. Even this guy can't overcome all that.)
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Veraciousness

customer_reviews.title: Poor signal quality, frequent connection drops
customer_reviews.text: This is amongst the crappiest devices I have used. It had frequent signal issues in my modest sized apartment. I used both the channels and tried to split the load, but this was as painful as it could get. I bought nearly the most expensive consumer Wifi router I could buy and what a piece of trash it was! After using it for over 4 years, I bought a single Google Wifi router and it works like a champ. It does have a major shortcoming - the only way to configure it is using the app, which is good, but limited.
customer_reviews.author: Deepak Mohanty

customer_reviews.title: Wrong device.
customer_reviews.text: I asked for a replacement for the device that I pay every month for. I tried to explain the two devices to them and unfortunately they sent me the router but it was the modem that I needed. So I’m still paying. Thankx
customer_reviews.author: Daud

customer_reviews.title: Using as an Access Point
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Router and WiFi access point . Had to call Tech support to assist in setting it up as a Access Point, case C6708369. The CSR Badge AR004205 was of great help. Had it up and running in no time. I wish D-Link had put the instructions to put it in Access Mode in the user manual on online. I set this next to my Apple Air Port Extreme, took my laptop running inSSider and moved to the far point in my house, the signal strengths in both bands were the same. This is no technical test or review, just results of my findings. I love the Airport Extreme, but for the $$ this would be my choice.
customer_reviews.author: PuroOro

customer_reviews.title: this is an excellent purchase. The menu system covers everything imaginable for ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly fast. Someone posted that it was lacking in the setup and config panel. The config is for advanced users and covers all bases and then some. If you are a novice, you can take advantage of the fast speed. If you are advanced and wireless savvy, this is an excellent purchase. The menu system covers everything imaginable for configurations and security. Tech support is amazing as well. I will never buy Netgear again. Thanks D-Link
customer_reviews.author: R. Garden

customer_reviews.title: Great speed
customer_reviews.text: I had an older D-Link wireless router and was having difficulty getting a good signal from the second floor. I was only getting 1 bar which correlated to about 5 Mbps. With this new router I now get about 58 Mbps consistently​. I also have the ability to split some of my devices off on the 2.4 and 5 GHz bands. My daughter loves that she can give her friends quick easy access to the guest network bands and that also has 2.4 and 5 GHz options.
customer_reviews.author: Captivated

customer_reviews.title: this was supposedly the best on the market
customer_reviews.text: this was supposedly the best on the market. Its crazy expensive!! Itworks marginally better than my old unit,but after 3 moths it has started to generate errors and needs to be reset frequently. It gets verty very hot so I think the build quality is poor. Not worth the money bought on March 8 and is all but dead on June 20 yuck!
customer_reviews.author: Donald K. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Router
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a D-Link 825, and the AC1750 works much better, especially the 5G band. I now stream internet and home media at 867mbs. I use the DWA-182 wireless adapter on my office PC, and a AC 1200 in wireless media bridge mode to feed the TV, receiver, DVR, and BD Player (each plugs into a GB port on the AC 1200 switch). My internet runs at full speed (50mbs) across the home network. The lan shows connection speeds of 867mbs, but I don't have anyway of measuring the actual throughput.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Best in Class
customer_reviews.text: Simply put I been in market for new router for a couple of months I read many reviews and generally everyone had the same thing to say best you can buy at it price point. As the number or wireless increased in our personal network along with all the networks in my neighbor it become clear that we where suffering performance issues due to the interference for all the other networks. This cut thru that interference like better and just deliver extremely excellent performance. I strongly recommend you buy this router over the some of the crappy netgear routers.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Never did get it to work correctly. Would not ...
customer_reviews.text: Never did get it to work correctly. Would not do the automatic settings properly. I'm not a guru and ended up disconnecting it, putting it back in the box and it's now sitting on a shelf in the closet. re-installed our old one and just accepted the fact I'm not going to get it to work correctly. Anyone wanna buy it on the cheap?
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Router
customer_reviews.text: I was using a Cisco Router "N" and was not able to get a strong enough signal in the family room to run the Fire TV Stick. The router is in the basement (West end of house) and the TV is on the main floor *East end of house). With the AD Smartbeam 1750 I have a strong signal everywhere in the house. I am totally pleased with this router and highly recommend it;
customer_reviews.author: John C. T. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: I have to admit the Setup was easy. But
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit the Setup was easy. But, when I connected to the cable modem, I could not see any strength of wireless signal on my laptop (just 2 bars) and I am sitting at 1 ft. from router. Now what, may be to do a speed-test for 5GHz and 2.5 GHz (as this was my first gigabit router) but pathetic 5 mbps download and 3 mbps upload achieved. (I have 100 mbps connection by SB6141 and my 4 yr old router has 30mbps). At this point I don't like to downgrade my wireless speed. I just decided to return a product without thinking twice. This router is Just a useless POS.
customer_reviews.author: Mike JR

customer_reviews.title: Wireless gaming on multiple devices and more, all simultaneously!
customer_reviews.text: This has made my online wireless gaming dream a reality. I have a PS4, PS3 AND XBOX 360 with a laptop and two phones all connected at once, WITHOUT LAG! This dual bandwidth is FANTASTIC! The canister style is strange in comparison to other routers but it fits well on my desk and isn't too large/in the way. Setup is easy. D link has an online feature to control the router, great feature! Great product! CON: Have some issues detecting the 5G network signal on devices, some won't detect it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Browning

customer_reviews.title: Great for multiple Xbox ones
customer_reviews.text: Works great with 2 Xbox ones. Both Xbox ones keep am open Nat with all games. Not having any trouble with signal drop. The interface is not as good as asus but the performance has them beat by far.
customer_reviews.author: Mike 82

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage and range
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to upgrade an old Dlink router that had seen better days. Installation was no problem, particularly since I was upgrading from a Dlink product and was familiar with the software. I don't know that it's any faster but I can say that I am getting better range and more consistent coverage throughout my house which has two storeys and a basement. I have not used the cloud function at all or the mobile app but didn't really think I was going to use it to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: cathjock

customer_reviews.title: Garbage router, garbage support
customer_reviews.text: Router constantly drops from network. DLink no longer supports this device, Firmware no longer in library. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M

customer_reviews.title: Good wireless router
customer_reviews.text: It's very good dual range routers and better performance and reliable coverage delivering stronger & excellent signal, I need to attache with NAS for home cloud application, I'll update the review once it is done. -------- NAS been order not arrive yet, I just connected to 120 GB hard disk on it with USB cable, working flawlessly accessed local and remote with apple product but could not accessed with windows internet explorer, ( Problem with this webpage caused Internet explorer to close and reopen the tab ) as per D- link technical support I should contact to nearest D-Link server in the region, O..OO ..OO ???
customer_reviews.author: Kakang Ragiel

customer_reviews.title: Very good Router and extremly easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very good Router and extremly easy to install. I am using it inconjuction with my Comcast Router as a seperate dedicated router for my secure D-Link cameras and it works very well. I also have used it for my ipad wife... and I can tell its quicker ability to download than the Comcast router. I am happy with this - great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Just passble, and expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Router is flaky, speeds aren't that great, and most disappointingly the wifi range is worse than the one on our ATT router. I take off three stars because of the wifi range, and because the website block list doesn't work for me--which was the reason I purchased a new router to begin with. I'm hoping firmware will help fix problems over time, but I am not happy with the money I spent
customer_reviews.author: NFC

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This item worked great out of the box but after a month it keeps disconnecting from internet and there is no problem with the ISP or wiring. All my research says its a defective unit, but I cannot return because its outside the return window. I have had Dlink before and had good luck until this one. I paid allot of money and cant return it.
customer_reviews.author: JAH

customer_reviews.title: Able to MONITOR traffic + great connection
customer_reviews.text: I use to run netflix streaming + playing online games such as SC2, D3 + twitch TV. In addition to this, my wife would jump on her laptop in order to do some work online through a VPN connection. this would effect my ability to watch twitch TV is 720p+ and higher. The video would stutter, run okay for a little bit and die down. I got rid of that old router, use my new D-Link wireless and BAM. no issues and watching 720p+ with ease :) Thank you PC E-sports gaming (Starcraft 2) for mentioning this so I can research it. it is exactly what I've been looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Derric Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Router works great in our 5 bedroom home!!! Our last gaming router crapped out on us a while back so we purchased this one as a replacement. This one works so well in our home. The kids have great reception in the basement while gaming in their bedrooms and the upstairs is completely covered as well. Would definitely recommend this to anyone needing a new router!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren T

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: the router is working excellent and has resolved all my previous router problems. I did have to move it upstairs with my Dlink cameras in order to have it reach the one in the attached garage. Seems to be a good product so far. I have had this for 3 weeks now. The only issues I have with D Link camera and I guess the router is when the power goes out the router will reset power but the cameras are always far as I can tell. For the product though it seems to be working well.
customer_reviews.author: Dana L. Forrester

customer_reviews.title: Love this router
customer_reviews.text: We have 150mbps connection from Comcast. Our wifi flies! Love this router. Never had any issues with it, great range, and super reliable. We have a basement with router upstairs - still pulling 85mbps down.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Give this one six stars.
customer_reviews.text: It appears that the 2.4 can lockup while the 5Gig is fine, but that has only happened a couple of times. I got the AP to replace and older D-Link (8-10 years) AP. The old AP would not forward Ethernet wake-up packets used by printers (can't turn off) to conserve power. The end result was I would haft to go kick the printer to use it wirelessly, this new AP works perfectly with printing. I also like the dual band.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: ZOOM ZOOM- IT'S FAST
customer_reviews.text: This has been a solid router for us so far. The 5ghz band is blazing fast. It's nice to have that dual band option so all the devices don't get bogged down on the same band. Works well in a two story colonial. No problems with reception on the front porch, back yard, and down in the basement. A Great router for the price. We have been very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Philip B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: So far this is TONS more competent than my old Belkin N300. It can handle more devices being on it, the range is great, the connection isn't intermittent, and on top of that all of my game consoles have no problem finding matches because their NAT types have all been set to 2, which is something the Belkin could never do. Great router and totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: The Angry Otter

customer_reviews.title: excellent product & easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: i used this to build additional layers of security for my home network. i coupled this with another D-Link router to separate all of the devices on my formerly 'flat' network. defense in depth...that is what i'm talking about. i highly recommend this product as it delivers all of the stated features quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Naish Jr

customer_reviews.title: Fast, stable connections, great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old router that was starting to flake out on me. This one is fast, supports the 802.11ac standard, and is great for gaming, downloads, file transfer, and streaming HD video to a Roku. It is fast both via Ethernet as well as wireless. Lots of great configuration options as well. I would highly recommend that any buyer update the firmware regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Not Dependable product
customer_reviews.text: System just stop working , try to let Technician check but inform get system that lemon
customer_reviews.author: joy b. garcia

customer_reviews.title: Pros: USB3.0 port for NAS. Gig-E ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: USB3.0 port for NAS. Gig-E. Simultaneous 2.4Ghz 450Mb g and 5Ghz 1300Mb n/ac networks. Cons: Settings change initiates reboot and interruption of service.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Bernadett

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.  Huge Mistake.
customer_reviews.text: I had been getting by with a cheap Netfear router for years and thought it was time to "upgrade" to this Dlink router. It has performed worse from day one. The range is less, and although at peak performance it's faster, it cuts out completely about once per day! Not acceptable for a modern router.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: The wireless isn't working as it should. My internet provider told me I should return this router and get a different one (or replacement) but amazon won't let me because it's been 5 weeks since I've bought it. Frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Damn fast and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: My place was suffering from device overload when we had more people move in. Decided to spend a little bit more on a router to see if that fixed the problem and my word it certainly did. This router is damn fast and it looks awesome pretty much anywhere. I can't see myself using another router until the technology has bypassed AC.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Invested in the DLINK home security cameras and noticed that my wireless in the house was very slow, and not all of the cameras could even connect to my old router. Decided to splurge and go for this big one! What great results! Fast and easy set up, and increased speed. Could not be happier! The dual band definitely provides better results than normal routers. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Becker

customer_reviews.title: Impressed by D-Link once more
customer_reviews.text: i had beed using the DIR-655 (and DAP-1522) for (close to 10) years, then it started to develop a "hiccup" and would drop the wi-fi signal from time to time, well one of them was doing it... so I replaced them both. The 1750 was a great upgrade from the DIR-655, I really enjoy the dual band feature as our ROKU streams our movies on the 5 gig frequency and the laptop is happy on the 2.4 gig frequency. The cloud storage was very easy to setup once I did a firmware update on the router. I would recommend the 1750 to any that want a solid, durable router.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hank

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I needed to upgrade my home router due to significant increase of wireless traffic in my house. I purchased this product and installed it without a hitch. I run simultaneous (depends on your bandwidth) movies and other activities without any problems. Very happy with this purchase....
customer_reviews.author: T. Imai

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I was using an older D-Link that worked, just not in a few spaces of my small house and definately not just out the front door a few steps. Speed was conked out the moment a second user logged in. Not now, the 1750 runs very well and coverage is now complete.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Berryhill

customer_reviews.title: Speeds just ok, Cloud capabilities annoying
customer_reviews.text: The advertised speeds were not any better than my previous wireless router. (Airport Extreme 5th Gen) Setting up an internal network was not straightforward. When I tried to ping from internal machine A to internal machine B, an external address was reported. I speculate it had something to do with the cloud capabilities of this device but I could not find any way to disable them.
customer_reviews.author: Gregsonian

customer_reviews.title: This is a great router!
customer_reviews.text: This device blow my mind, after having lots of issues with my previous router, all that is in the past, I have to tv doing Netflix at the same time, more than 3 cellphones connected to it, 2 laptops, and one time had 19 devices connected to it, problems NONEXISTENT!!!
customer_reviews.author: obaquerizo

customer_reviews.title: Great for streaming video
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and easy to use. My previous router didn't have the bandwidth for streaming data without the occasional pause. With this router I can be streaming video to two TVs without having buffer under run (no pausing of the video).
customer_reviews.author: Bill F.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for the range, speed and easy setup. Never mind the gimmicky smartphone apps
customer_reviews.text: I have no need or desire to use the free smartphone app. It works, but is more of a gimmick than anything else. Other than that, the router was easy to set up, and has worked flawlessly. I get much better speed and range than I had with my older 802.11 N router. For the money, I think it's a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Turner

customer_reviews.title: Does Everything it should.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older 'n' router and cannot believe the speeds I get now. Previous speeds between the router, a d-Link DIR 655 with a Mac Book Pro Retina were on average 110-120 Mbs, it now is at 450 Mbs. Streaming through my Blu-Ray has also improved immensely. It was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: MCL MN

customer_reviews.title: AR004212 was wonderful spending many hours helping me resolve the problems
customer_reviews.text: Having problems with timewarner cable's connection. They replaced my modem and contacted Dlink to reconnect my router (Case # C6696794). AR004212 was wonderful spending many hours helping me resolve the problems. Unfortunately within 30 mins after ending our call the connection is lost again. Luckily I had timewarner leave the wifi on their modem on, despite extra charges.
customer_reviews.author: KathyS

customer_reviews.title: Easy Easy Easy...
customer_reviews.text: I got this in the mail, hooked it up and Bam! it installed itself! Fast, reliable connections to everything and everyone in our home network,(five smart phones, four TV's, and an assortment of players all on Wi-Fi and all blazing fast with this router. The best little gadget I've ever bought!
customer_reviews.author: George Bourus

customer_reviews.title: Average performance.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered mine in April 2014. Died on April 2016. It was okay, but not great. Between D-Link and Linksys I've replaced many wireless routers. Going with Netgear this time.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Cline

customer_reviews.title: Working great. We live in the country and have signal ...
customer_reviews.text: Working great. We live in the country and have signal 400 ft away inside another building. Luckily it is password protected for those that live in the city. This is my 2nd D-link router our last one was 6 years old and we needed more speed with our family using more devices.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: It is an awesome router (when it wants to work)
customer_reviews.text: Most of the time it works great for all of my devices, but every now and then (1-3x per week) I am forced to power cycle the router to keep my Chromecasts and wife's iPhone connected. The only common denominator I have found so far is the fact that they are all running on the 2.4Ghz channel, and my other (functional) devices use the 5Ghz. I will update this post once I have had a chance to spend some time on the issue, and one of my first steps is going to be re-flashing the firmware with DD-WRT (yes, I have tried the latest D-Link firmware (as well as some older versions)).
customer_reviews.author: Kris Templin

customer_reviews.title: Great for multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: We have multiple devices in our home 3 laptops, 4 iPads, Xbox 360, 2 ps3s, 3 smartphones and our old router just couldn't stay connected so we researched routers trying to find the right one and decided on this one, we definitely made the right choice this one hasn't stopped working once. If you have lots of devices and you need to stay connected to the internet this is the right one for you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Misty O

customer_reviews.title: Would by another.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be holding up and has good options. I get about 3 bars through 3 walls in after 30' away in the house. I like the design and the fact that it doesn't have a ton of meaningless lights flashing all the time.
customer_reviews.author: It's Chuck Norse

customer_reviews.title: Game Up!
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a lot of routers. As for as using it for a Gaming router it is a lag free device. There might be others out there, but you will still like to quality, range and features to match any other on the market now.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but great preformance (1 day of use)
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install (once the very thick shrink wrap was off). Pretty much unplug the old router and modem, hook up the ethernet between the modem and new router, plug (power) the modem then do the same for the router. Use the IP address to finish the set up. It took about 10 minutes. So far works great for gaming on a desk top with a LinkSys wireless N card. I would give 5 stars, but I have only been using it a day.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Board

customer_reviews.title: I like the produck it just the range of wifi is ...

customer_reviews.title: works fine, did not extend range or strength
customer_reviews.text: Got it hooked up with a small amount of hassle (had to call dlink for help and re-boot a number of times). Once it was working we thought it would offer greater strength in the kitchen and back bedroom, but my wife says there is less of a signal than with our old "N" router. Maybe I am doing something wrong? There are two different bands you can name and sign on to. Not sure it has given us any increased productivity.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Nice router when it works
customer_reviews.text: Nice router when it works. Returned it once on warranty and then had it recently just stop working again. It always behaved oddly with random restarts.

customer_reviews.text: Works very well for my home network. Nice to have two different speeds and connections for the growing number of wifi devices in my home.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely work horse for the home.

The number of bars of reception on devices seems to vary wildly although I am not sure it a router issue. I like the fact I can remotely control it when I travel.

customer_reviews.title: These are absurdly high speed and low latency - it's like having a GbE wire from my computer upstairs to ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using two in bridged mode (with no other clients). These are absurdly high speed and low latency - it's like having a GbE wire from my computer upstairs to the router downstairs and across the apartment.

customer_reviews.text: Easy setup in my three room apt. and deck. 2 fire tvs, 1 kindle, 1kindle fire, 2 desktop PC, 1 laptop, 1 smart tv, &1 printer all networked, and securitized, no problems.

customer_reviews.text: Very nice wireless router and gives me great coverage in my apartment. I like that it has two broadcast frequencies because it helps with coverage.

customer_reviews.title: The worst router I ever used!
customer_reviews.text: The worst router I ever used. Devices keep dropping connection. Constantly have to restart router to have devices reconnect. Called technical support told to reset to default settings and go through setup wizard. Same problem! D-link will not replace unit. Save your money and buy a different brand I wish I did.

product_meta.title: D-Link Wireless AC Smartbeam 1750 Mbps Home Cloud App-Enabled Dual-Band Gigabit Router (DIR-868L)
product_meta.description:
Upgrade to Revolutionary AC Performance: The D-Link Wireless AC1750 Dual Band Gigabit Cloud Router (DIR-868L) delivers next generation wireless speed and coverage to all your Wi-Fi devices. With wireless dual band speeds of 450 and 1300Mbps, the DIR-868L avoids interference to deliver the fastest wireless speeds, improved coverage and reliable connections. The DIR-868L is ideal for streaming HD video, gaming, connecting multiple devices, and watching shows on your TV - all at the same time. The DIR-868L is also backward-compatible with your existing wireless 802.11a/b/g/n devices for seamless connectivity. D-Link's free mobile apps provide easy setup, remote monitoring and access to content from anywhere on your Smartphone or Tablet. Backward Compatibility: While the DIR-868L delivers AC performance to your home network, it is also backward compatible with all of your existing a/b/g/n devices. This means you can enjoy all the benefits of wireless AC without worrying about annoying compatibility issues. Simply download the QRS Mobile to your mobile device, follow the intuitive setup wizard, and you'll have your wireless AC home network up and running in minutes. Dual Band Advantage: The Wireless AC1750 Dual Band Gigabit Cloud Router delivers dual band performance for intelligent, versatile, interference-free bandwidth. Check your email and surf the Internet on the 2.4GHz band; and game, make Skype calls and stream HD movies to multiple devices using the cleaner, interference-free 5GHz band. Whatever you like to do online, dual band has you covered. my D-Link Cloud Services: D-Link's Cloud Routers also provide the added benefit of remote network management and remote file access via my D-Link Cloud Services. Take advantage of everything my D-Link Cloud has to offer through the free Share Port Mobile, QRS Mobile, and my D-Link Lite apps and web portal (my D-Link.com).

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Next Generation Wireless Technology - Wireless AC1750 for optimized performance and reliable coverage delivering high-quality HD video streaming, gaming and file transfers.
Dual Band Performance - Up to 450Mbps (2.4GHz) + 1300Mbps (5GHz) to deliver fast wireless speeds and less interference for maximum throughput
Backward Compatibility - Compatible with a/b/g/n devices
my D-Link Cloud Management - Monitor and manage your network from anywhere
Gigabit Speed - Four Gigabit Ethernet ports for superior device connectivity
Easy Setup with intelligent browser wizard and Quick Router Setup Mobile app
Preset security with advanced WPA2 encryption

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars413 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
